paragraphs: At Prague's Václav Havel Airport, flight delays regularly occur due to vibrating objects in passengers' luggage. For safety reasons, police officers are forced to unload suspicious baggage and carefully inspect its contents, including with the help of service dogs and explosives experts.
Fortunately, so far none of the cases posed a real threat. In the suitcases, they found switched-on mobile phones, electric shavers, electric toothbrushes, sex toys, and other devices with motors.
However, each such check meant at least stress for the passengers, and often financial losses due to flight delays.
The police gave travelers a simple advice consisting of several points on how not to spoil the beginning of their vacation:
✅ Make sure all electronics in your luggage are turned off and cannot turn on spontaneously. Think carefully about what makes sense to put in your luggage and what to take in your carry-on.
✅ Remember that every vibrating or suspicious luggage means a delay.
✅ The irresponsibility of one jeopardizes a comfortable flight for everyone.
✅ Due to a trivial matter, a vacation can start with stress or not start at all.
👉 A detailed list of items that are prohibited to carry in your carry-on or checked baggage can be found on the official website of Prague Airport at this link.
